intro: Gnaphalium monocephalum, commonly known as the single-headed everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in a single, rounded head, giving it its common name. It is often found in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Gnaphalium monocephalum is also known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
